description:
Yuu Watase's Masterpiece Collection Volume 5 consists of four stories.

1. Mint de Kiss Me (ミントでKiss me)
There is a legend that if you kiss the man you like with a mint candy in your mouth, you can become one with your love. Misono is a rather superstitious girl who decides to test this out on Tohno-sensei, a young teacher she has a crush on. Unfortunately for her, she makes a mistake in the attempt to surprise him and instead kisses her fellow classmate Shindou. Of course this would be the time for the legend to work quite literally as Misono’s spirit enters Shindou’s body.

2. Genseika (源生花)
Chiya goes to school with her friends and witnesses one of them die suddenly as a flower bursts out of him. The three friends had been together since elementary school, the death hitting Chiya and Yutaka hard. When other people begin dying from the flowers, they investigate possible reasons for such usual deaths. To her surprise, she finds answers close to home.

3. Furimuke Romance! (ふりむけロマンス！)
The hero of girls targeted by guys peeking into the locker room, Taka has quite the violent tomboy reputation. But all she wants is for some handsome guy to ask her out. A cheerful street vender, Ryouta gives her a special ring with a heart locket pendent to hold pictures. When two photos are enclosed, romance is in the air.

4. Nakago Shikkari Shinasai! (心宿しっかりしなさい！)
Involves the scenario where Fushigi Yuugi was actually done by real actors. Unfortunately, Nakago (stage name) is a lot more unconfident than the character he plays. At least his one main fan, an unnamed woman with flowers, is there to support him through his worries.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Anthology
tags.description: A collection of separate works collated into a single release.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

node.description: [Twitter](https://twitter.com/wataseyuu_) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/wataseyuu) Identifies as X-gender, a form of non-binary gender identity in Japan, but prefers feminine pronouns in English. Watase started drawing manga at the age of five, and by the age of 17 she aspired to be a professional mangaka. She was bullied relentlessly from elementary school until high school, eventually culminating in a suicide attempt. These experiences were later used for scenes in Arata: The Legend. She credits her recovery to religion, as she is a member of Soka Gakkai, a Buddhist organization that promotes peace centered on respect for the dignity of life, and she often provide illustrations for the organization's newsletter. In 1998, Watase won the 43rd (1997) Shogakukan Manga Award for Ayashi no Ceres.
